person.persName: Ephraim B. Pope (Washington County, Kentucky, grocer, farmer, and soldier.)

body.p: Washington County, Kentucky, grocer, farmer, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of George H. Pope and Delila Broyles Pope. Married to Mary E. Simms Pope in Washington County, Kentucky, on January 22, 1861. Father of Sallie Pope and Margaret Pope. Attended school in Boyle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned two enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1850. Grocer in Washington County, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned seventeen enslaved persons in Washington County in 1860. Farmer in Washington County in 1863. Served in the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private. Captured in Morgan County, Ohio, on July 23, 1863. Prisoner of war at Camp Chase in Columbus, Ohio, from July 25, 1863, to August 22, 1863. Prisoner of war at Camp Douglas in Chicago, Illinois, from August 22, 1863, to February 24, 1865. Paroled on February 24, 1865.
